attributes.action: Should all MPs be sacked for not following the democratic will of the electorate
attributes.additional_details:
1. Taking no deal off of the table restricts the countries ability to negotiate from a position of strength.
2. The majority of the country voted to come out of the EU no matter what their reason.  MP's have continued to undermine the people by saying that we didn't know what we were voting for.   
3. Before the referendum MP's said they would respect & follow through on the result of the vote.
4. MP's continually fail the public & have proven they are incapable of running the country.
attributes.background:
1. MP's are clearly following their own agenda and not their constituents.
2. MP's are ignoring the concerns of the people when voiced.
3. MP's have shown they are incapable of being able to follow up on the democratic vote.

rejection.details: The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for removing MPs from office because of their views or opinions.
